title: Drawing, "David Milton Apartment 420 East 52nd Street: Folding Table", October 19, 1937
medium: Graphite and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 6429/F.S./MILTON, OLSSON/10/19/37; above stamp in graphite: TWO FOLDING TABLES/30" x 30" x 28" HIGH/LEATHER TOP/APRON SOLID OAK - BLEACHED WHITE/4 SLIDES EACH TO HAVE TWO SPINNINGS/AS PER DRAWINGS/SLIDES TO HAVE STOPS & CATCHES &/ FINGER GRIP/1" DIA. POL. CHROM FOLDING LEGS WITH/LOCKING DEVICE;  dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for two folding tables. Square table with leather top, four straight, foldable legs. Four sliding trays on each side with removable spinning for glasses, and removable spinning for ashes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "David Milton Apartment 420 East 52nd Street: Folding Table", October 19, 1937.
October 19, 1937. Graphite and black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-764.
